item.description: By: John Shepler We’ve all experienced the frustration of a slow or unresponsive website, especially when it’s crucial for work or entertainment. This sluggishness often stems from resource starvation, where the system lacks sufficient resources like processing power, memory, storage, or bandwidth to handle the current demand. Resource Starvation Resource starvation occurs when a system’s capacity is exceeded. A sudden surge in demand, such as a product going viral, can overload a website designed for typical traffic levels, leading to a frustrating experience for users and potentially lost business.
